Posted 4 days ago. Owned for 11 months when reviewed.

div.p: I was tired of using bagged vacuum and finally invested in a bagless one. I'm happy with this purchase. It isn't too heavy, and the retraceable cable IS THE BEST PART. Assembly was very easy for someone who isn't very handy.

div.div: I would recommend this to a friend

div.div: Posted 1 year ago. Owned for 1 month when reviewed.

div.p:
I paid for this vacuum in-store and had it delivered since they were out of stock in the Duluth, MN store. One complaint I have on the delivery is it was suppose to be there on a Saturday (two days later) and it was switched to a Monday. I was not happy about that since there's been so many packages being "porch pirated" as of late and was worried I may be another victim of said pirates. Thankful to my parents for being able to get it from my residence shortly after it was dropped off.
Now, on to the vacuum itself. This vacuum, after the first use, picked up SO much more than my previous vacuum. I was amazed. Dollar for dollar this vacuum is well worth it. I was told that the bagless container wouldn't be as good as a bagged one. I beg to differ and enjoy using this machine, dumping the contents after finishing, and having to not worry about a bag any longer. Thank you Hoover.

div.div: I would recommend this to a friend

div.div: Posted 1 year ago. Owned for less than 1 week when reviewed.

div.p: The Hoover Wind Tunnel 2 is a great vacumn....great suction....easy to use....cleanable filter. At regular price it's a bargain....on sale it's a steal !!!. People who under rate this little gem, probably are not maintaining it correctly.....you have to keep the filter and dust container clean....and check the roller for anything wrapped around it or collected to it. This is a nice vacumn....maintain it and it will do a good job keeping your house clean....Vacumnlng 101....one last thing.......height adjustment....it's there for a reason. Once a month or two after cleaning out the dust cup....sprinkle about half a cup of baking soda on floor....vacuum it up and put back in closet. This will help keeping your vacumn smelling fresh....especially if you have pets!!!

div.div: I would recommend this to a friend

div.div: Posted 2 years ago. Owned for 1 month when reviewed.

div.p: We have been using a cordless, battery powered vacuum for 4-5 years prior to getting this. When we vacuumed the carpeted areas, we would always get a full canister of junk, so there was no reason to question its performance. We decided to go with corded this time, and the power and performance so far has made us question how well the previous vacuum was actually doing. The first time that I used this was a day after the carpet was vacuumed with the other vacuum, and it filled the canister with actual dirt, not just like dust and dust bunnies. Since then, I have been trying to vacuum on a daily basis to see how much that it keeps picking up from the carpet. It is pretty gross to see how much thick dirt keeps showing up in the bottom of the canister. Definitely pleased so far. Some cons; weight and obviously the cord, because I was coming from a cordless. However, I am fine with that based on the difference in performance.

div.div: I would recommend this to a friend

div.div: Posted 1 year ago. Owned for 4 months when reviewed.

div.p: Great Vacuum. A lot of power and gets the job done. It makes quick work of a lot of carpet. I Really like the retractable cord. My only knocks on it would be that it is heavy and since it has a wide base it has trouble getting into tight places like beside a toilet. The tools and extension wand are great though because you can get the tight spots like around the fridge and washing machine. Also there is an attachment that really helps with removing cat hair from my couch.

div.div: I would recommend this to a friend

div.div: Posted 11 months ago. Owned for 2 weeks when reviewed.

div.p:
This is our second Hoover. The last one all the plastic pieces kept breaking and parts were no longer available to make repairs. This unit although sold as the same as the prior is close. The canister is smaller, and the cord is shorter. I feel having the auto real on the cord makes up for its length.
The functionality of the vacuum is just as you would expect we have 3 dogs and vacuum about 3-4 times a week so our expectation is to get 1-2 years out of a vacuum and so far all our Hoovers have exceed this.

div.div: I would recommend this to a friend

div.div: Posted 2 years ago. Owned for 8 months when reviewed.

div.p: I bought this for a small apartment. I use it for everything from carpet to tile to other surfaces. It works extremely well. The chamber is also extremely easy to release and empty which is a huge plus. Oddly, one thing I really love is the cord retractor. It reminds me of the vacuum I had growing up. Unplug it when you're done, press on the button, and the cord spools right up. I have used this frequently since I've had it and had zero issues. The accessories all tuck neatly away without any game of Tetris to get them in place.

div.div: I would recommend this to a friend

div.p: Very pleased with the vacuum, It replaced my last Hoover. Love that it has a height adjustment and easy to empty the contents. Highly recommend.

div.div: I would recommend this to a friend

div.h4: You can never go wrong with a Hoover.

div.div: Posted 3 months ago. Owned for 3 weeks when reviewed.

div.p: You can never go wrong with a Hoover! Our old one took a lot of abuse and after someone in the household used it outside to clean ... well we needed a new one. This one is improved and again we love the brand. That retractable cord is a big plus.

div.div: I would recommend this to a friend

Cleaning from Floor to Ceiling. The Multi-Floor Brush Roll allows you to turn the brush roll on for optimal cleaning on carpets and off to prevent scattering of debris on hard floors for a more effective clean. Advanced Multi-Cyclonic Technology gives you a continuous cleaning experience with No Loss of Suction,** while WindTunnel® 2 Technology creates 2 channels of suction to lift and remove surface debris and deep down embedded dirt. The hassle-free 25 ft. power cord automatically retracts in seconds, so you never have to wrap a cord again and with up to 16 ft. of cleaning reach you can clean dirt and dust anywhere. When we vacuumed the carpeted areas, we would always get a full canister of junk, so there was no reason to question its performance. We decided to go with corded this time, and the power and performance so far has made us question how well the previous vacuum was actually doing. The first time that I used this was a day after the carpet was vacuumed with the other vacuum, and it filled the canister with actual dirt, not just like dust and dust bunnies. Since then, I have been trying to vacuum on a daily basis to see how much that it keeps picking up from the carpet.
